title: Possible futures

author: Marko Jaklič, Ekonomska fakulteta, Univerza v Ljubljani

segmentation: As it was already said, I'm an economist and I will try to prove that I'm coming from the same world.
Somehow the only one that we have and.
Being an economist, of course, I still, as all other economists, I deal with development, not necessarily more, but at least better.
And in the last 20 years we preach something that is called sustainable development.
And what do we mean by sustainable development?
It is somehow a discussion or balancing of three precious things that we have.
Three capitals as we call them.
It is a natural capital.
It is our environment.
It is a human capital.
It is us humans and it is something that it is created.
It was probably created by our predecessors and it is our let's say mission or obligation that we deal carefully with all these three capitals.
And it is usually about question here.
Short term and long term.
And unfortunately, when I teach this to my students and I tell them you as developers, you have to develop this long-term responsibility.
The reality.
Despite this preaching of sustainability, is just the reverse.
So the whole society is very short term oriented, unfortunately.
So basically, the guys who are somehow responsible for not stability because we are not operating in stable.
Environment, but for some kind of a long term onism and I believe business people should be in this long term.
Onism and politicians as well.
Unfortunately, all of them fail.

So maybe just for the sake of curiosity, we can discuss a sustainable development at the country level at the global level of course, and also at the company level, or maybe even the personal level just for the sake of curiosity, how Slovenia is doing on the country, level comparison, beauty, context if you want.
As you can see, we are not that bad with respect to environmental issues.
Environmental indices as you can probably understand.
Who's here the 1st?
Are Slovenia is with respect to human capital?
We are not that bad as well as you can see we are even very close to Finland when we talk about inequality adjusted Human development index.
But we are quite bad with respect to the capital that was created and it should be somehow upgraded.
I usually say well if I inherited a farm from my father, it is my duty that I give it to my son in a much better position and he has the same kind of duty.
And basically we have forgot this simple natural principle in between.
So.
So, um.
If we are preaching or let's say if we are trying to execute the sustainability development in reality it is somehow challenged but by of course very unstable environment.
Alot of challenges I mentioned one which is nature I mentioned second which is about demography.
About humans.
We know that we are aging and this is a challenge to all of us, to businesses to individuals or we are facing.
Political challenges as well political changes.
Whether we're leaving bipolar or multipolar world, I don't know anymore, but maybe we are approaching bipolar world again.
Is what we're seeing, and everything is connected.
You know, energy issues here are very much connected to this.
Political disputes that we're facing today, so it is a very, very complex world that we live in.
The economic crisis that we are living in.
It's far, far from over.
The last one of this magnitude was from 1929 till let's say 1949.
The war in between.
Hopefully we are smarter today.
How to resolve it?
And I have to say that as a social scientist I'm not that optimist, so I don't see a pilot in the cockpit, you know so.
I don't know how we can resolve all these kind of issues, that's why because of my ignorance, I usually go and try to see what is happening in technology.
So maybe technology can help us in a better not in a worse way.
So we are facing in the same time with all other challenges.
We're facing industrial revolutions going on, not only the third one, the third one, sorry, but also the 4th one emerging.
And on the other side we also see companies that are.
Already notice war profiteers I would say but are already living according to some new standards and we should probably learn from them.
There are some of them, but just to give you one example value added for employees, something that we use as economists.

A lot value add it means if you add together profits, wages, interest, payment that you have to pay for the loans that you get from the bank and taxes for the government in Slovenia is 39,000 per employee euros per employee per employee.
It is half unfortunately of Austrian, but it is much less than these guys are doing with this companies.
For example, outfit Seven has around 1 million 9001 million, and it is not only about this digital gaming.
Whatever issue, I really should emphasize this company, local Motors.
Maybe you heard it, it's a completely new way of producing cars, so this is happening.
It is starting to happen at it is somehow interesting.
It might save us or.
Not.
I don't know.

So if I turn to technological development, what we hear what we think about today is about convergence, convergence, convergence in this key, enabling technologies as we believe these are the most important technologies that we see today and on the other side we see different markets, different trends, even this economic crisis has changed a little bit.
I would say our trends in our behavior.
Uh, share sharing economy etc etc.
This is more and more alive, so business models are changing and there are two words that I heard today a lot.
It is about collaboration.
Because you cannot do it even if you are the biggest company in the world.
Even Apple and this kind of companies are collaborating with.
With others on some kind of open innovation systems or platforms if you want so, and this is another word platform that I heard a lot today and because I'm here.
Speaking to primarily design community, I somehow felt I have to include design already, so hopefully it makes sense here.
I will try to elaborate on this later on, but I believe somewhere in between here.
There should be design.
OK let's.
Try to elaborate on this a little bit more.
I will not spend too much time on this technological development that everybody is changing.
Everything is changing, sorry.
So I would just skip this.

Very shortly, but it is not only that global value chains, meaning how the product product is created from the customer perspective, it is not only technology that is changing production models and even business models, it's also the globalization that is going on all other influences as well as political influences.
You know, the traditional model was that something is designed in the United States.
I don't know.
Apple products are designed in the United States and then produced in China.
So this linear model still predominant, I would say, but it is changing because there are more and more companies.
Even in China in other parts of the world that have the capacity and that they want to be part of a not such a linear model, they want to take share of this huge value.
Edits that I'm talking about.
So a lot of things are changing, so there are there as opportunities and as well as threats if we're not capable to deal with them.
So how are people responding to these challenges?
First, I will talk very briefly about how companies usually are responding, not necessarily Slovenian companies, but companies in general.
And then how, let's say policymakers or countries are responding to this huge challenges.
So usually companies go for something that is called open innovation, open innovation systems.
This is a very basic picture of it.
I will not go into details.

So basically they are realizing even the biggest companies that they have to include that they have to develop platforms of innovation in order to be successful and they are successful on these grounds and with.
Let's say these people to to say at least so.
But who?
Is behind, so who's the most important person behind you?
Will see that I will very much go to individuals, not not that much groups or teams, but individuals.
So basically here the question is who takes the responsibility?
Who takes the leadership and usually we say maybe to some surprise for you that yes, it's a revival of engineering.

Some months ago I was at Berkeley and I borrowed this from from one of my colleagues presentation from Berkeley when he was explaining that well, engineers will be the new leaders in the next 20 years, not finance guys and this kind of stuff, but engineers but the engineers that we produce or educate today are not the ones that are needed and basically he was saying, well we have to change them.
We have to educate them differently and this is where young lady was explaining before.
Yes, we.
As let's say designers, we would have to be raised differently in order to communicate with others probably, and I will not repeat what what is already written here.
For me it was very interesting that they are reforming their there.
Programs at Berkeley.
In starting with this, let's say values or or kind of a competence is that people students should have at the end of the educational process.
So now we discuss revival of engineers.
Who is it?
Is about entrepreneurs?
Even companies realize that this stop guys stop management guys don't see very far.
They might be sitting on the top sometimes, but they are far from the battle that is basically going on the battle in this value chains.

So basically what we're preaching, at least in business schools, is that this pyramid should be reversed that at the top we have entrepreneurs and the trip and err, entrepreneurialism as a habit is a very rare thinking in societies, you know, the.
The behavior of entrepreneurs is a bit crazy, unusual, but of course we have to find them and we have to feed them somehow and this is what, at least in principle in companies are trying to achieve.
And there is another word, and I'm happy because I introduced the word design again.
There is a kind of a design revolution and I'm serious.
It is design revolution in businesses.
You can read what we mean by design I believe in in business textbooks and this kind of stuff.
We are sometimes a bit.
Tool I would say.
Simple or romantic about what design thinking really is, but we believe that good designers or maybe even all designers.
Or although when I enter into some I don't know some houses.
I don't believe that designers were there at all.
So basically what we believe design thinking is it is first standing with empathy.
Real deep understanding of, let's say the customer.
If you are an ego, you can't understand somebody else.
Do we agree?
So then, to have a kind of a vision or even a visualized concept and then strategic business again designed.
So how you design it into a proper way of being a viable business at the end.
So where I see not spending too much time on this where I see a kind of let's say new message coming from this and.

It was mentioned already implicitly in some other presentations is we are trying to develop a common language language that we would understand each other, bringing developers together and I will define what I mean by developers very shortly.
Bringing people who are here to not develop again in assays sense that we would have more, but with that we might live somehow sustainably, better maybe.
So.

Another question, what are nations or separate nations like European Union doing with disrespect they have realized, at least in principle, in theory that we should be long term and for this long term we we need a kind of a platform of discussion and this is what they have created somehow.
What kind of policymaking?
How do we design policies?
It is very difficult to expect that bureaucrats would know what to do, but they should act as a kind of a moderate are's in this kind of a dynamic.
Circle or important institutions involved designing the future together.
At least in principle, this is the general ideology.
Also, for the operation of European Union.
And maybe a few flashes about where we we're Slovenia stands with respect to this innovativeness.
In a sense, we're not that bad.
So Slovenia is here a little bit below the EU average, but we're in the second legal.
As you see, the first link.
There are only four countries according to the scoreboard.
We are not that bad and we are basically improving in the last years, which is a good sign because I believe this is.
This is where we should.
So just you will get this presentation if you want.
It is here so just to show you what kind of criteria is behind deciding where we are standing.
You see here enablers from activities and then outputs slowly in Slovenia.
We are quite well here we were producing quite a number of new doctorates etc etc, but we are relatively very poor on the outcomes.
So basically we don't have very much value added as a consequence of what we are investing in.
So it might have happened, but we'll see.
So in general, what are Slovenian strengths?
Nationis means national innovation system strengths.
We are investing quite a lot of money and I will come back to this because this will be the crucial message that I want to share with you.
So we are investing in last year's quite a lot of money, which is primarily European money.
But still we are devoting it.
We're here.
As you can see, very high.
But on the other hand, this is what I already mentioned.
Weak relationships, few high tech firms and another very important thing is where the new idea comes from very closed environment.
So it is within the company.
Maybe suppliers tell me what to do or customers, but it is not a platform as you can see.
So the idea is our higher education institutions or public research organizations.
Nothing.
No idea come to companies.
So there is a problem probably.
Investing a lot of money but no platform behind it.
So in summary, and this will be a starting point of the hypothesis.
For my last, I hope crucial message.
So we have a bridging problem as many other countries do and I believe we have an international bridging problem.
It should not be in parenthesis.
We should consider it as a mistake.
It should be underlined international.
So on one side we have, let's say, ideas science and this kind of stuff.
And on the other we have technology firms.
This is that there are two sides of the same coin coin but huge River in between and I believe on this bridge we should.
We should have seen.
Whom walking from one to another?
Site, engineers, designers, entrepreneurs.
This is what I already mentioned mentioned.
So what we have done with respect to this so there is a problem of breach.
What we have done till now.
So what kind of innovation?
Better to say open innovation or bridging policies are already being used.
Some of you might might know some of them.
So in European Union we knew Framework 7.
Now we already live on framework eight.
There are many policies that.
They are trying to do bridging like I will talk specifically about one, but there are.
There are many others.
You can't read, but if you get the the paper version you will be able to read, so I'll not go into detail about cases but later on So what they're trying to do, but also at the national level.
Also the country level, and I will speak about Slovenia experience with disrespect.
There are different kind of network platform policies that try to bridge this.
These two sides of the River, so I believe the challenge is how to develop national.
And at the same time International Connect, internationally connected policies within not necessary on European Union but globally so.
What is our experience in the years 2000?
In the last, let's say financial Framework 2009, 2013, we have spent on these two.
On these three segments, 330 million, which is quite a lot, and as you can see, we have center of excellence, eight of them fully supported by public money.
We have competent centers.
We have one as well as design competence center, I believe seven or eight or something of them, 65 support it, and I will tell you shortly.
Basically, it's 100 supported by public money be cause they can manage it.
And they they.
Then there are some kind of a regional more development centers or so.
Believe me 100% supported by public money.
Easy public money coming from and I don't invest my own money.
I don't risk of course I'm sarcastic right now so.
And what I claim here and I will show you why there is behind this.
There is no real international networking and hopefully you got it.
Why international networking is necessary?
You have to be part of the networks that are developing new value chains for let's say 2020 two 1030 if you are not there.
If you are closed into your Slovenian environment, living on the public money.
I don't know where you are going to be in the next decade, so I will try to show that.
Paradoxically, since we entered European Union we, I believe that we are going to open ourselves because I believe this is.
This is what a small nation has to do.
We got even more narrow closed into our own.
Whatever we are trying to achieve here.
Just one.
Sample I have plenty of them Ki see this is knowledge and innovation, community community communities.
These are kind of our European centers of excellence, so it's a European level policy instrument to support platforms and they are to develop 9 platforms.
They started with three this year.
Three additional will be created and there are three more by 2018.
This is how it is expecting.
So their ICT information communication technology then.
There are there are climate as you can see and energy kind of a center of excellence.
And what I'm trying to show you here.
This is what I will skip.
Just use one energy kits, let's call it that way, do you see all these flags or whatever?
That is what they represent.
And can you see Slovenia?
Even multi, even this kind of countries, even Bulgaria, Romania, latecomers.
Can you see Slovenia?
We are nowhere.
And for me this is a disaster so.
Right now we are discussing we are late comers discussing smart specialisation strategies and by the way you probably know design is somehow one of the horizontals still and entrepreneurship as well.
I think that's OK.
I have other complaints about this document of course, but I will not go into detail.
But if you ask me if I have any single recommendation for our policymakers, although I believe we should not expect much, much from them, they will be late comers as well.
Maybe that's the question, maybe?
We you should do something about platform development and then pushing towards maybe also the responsibility of the policymakers.
So what my message would be?
Try to do internationalized or you do from the very beginning, so the bridge should be internationalized from the very beginning.

Might seem somehow against some of the expectations of designers right now discussing before how how precarious work is predominant, etc, etc, but I would really emphasize individuals empowering them to really enter into international platforms, and when international, whatever comes, I believe, also Slovenian platforms will be grounded on kind of a, let's say, healthy, healthy basis, and I believe we should discuss this because I don't have.
Clear answers, but I I see some very clear past which was not very successful, so thank you.
